analyzed: thera vāda vinaya

original: 24. Vassikasāṭikasikkhāpada
analyzed: vassika sāṭika sikkhāpada
translated: The training rule on rainy season bathing robes

original: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṁ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.🔽Tena kho pana samayena bhagavatā bhikkhūnaṁ vassikasāṭikā anuññātā hoti.
analyzed: tena samayena buddhaḥ bhagavā sāvatthiyam viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme  tena kho pana samayena bhagavatā bhikkhūnam vassika sāṭikā anuññātā hoti
translated: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,🔽the Buddha had allowed the rainy season robes for the monks.

original: Chabbaggiyā bhikkhū—“bhagavatā vassikasāṭikā anuññātā”ti,🔽paṭikacceva vassikasāṭikacīvaraṁ pariyesanti,
analyzed: chabbaggiyā bhikkhu bhagavatā vassika sāṭikā anuññātā ati  paṭikaccā iva vassika sāṭika cīvaram pariyesanti
translated: The monks from the group of six heard that the Buddha had allowed the rainy season robes,🔽and so they started looking for rainy season robes before the proper time.

original: paṭikacceva katvā nivāsenti,
analyzed: paṭikaccā iva katvā nivāsenti
translated: They made them before the proper time and then wore them.

original: jiṇṇāya vassikasāṭikāya naggā kāyaṁ ovassāpenti.
analyzed: jiṇṇāya vassika sāṭikāya naggā kāyaṃ ovassāpenti
translated: When their rainy season robes were worn out, they bathed naked.

original: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā …pe… te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
analyzed: ye te bhikkhū appicchā pe te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti
translated: The monks of few desires complained and criticized them,🔽“How can the monks from the group of six do this?”

original: “kathañhi nāma chabbaggiyā bhikkhū paṭikacceva vassikasāṭikacīvaraṁ pariyesissanti, paṭikacceva katvā nivāsessanti, jiṇṇāya vassikasāṭikāya naggā kāyaṁ ovassāpessantī”ti.
analyzed: katham hi nāma chabbaggiyāḥ bhikkhū paṭikacca iva vassika sāṭika cīvaram pariyesissanti paṭikacca iva katvā nivāsessanti jiṇṇāya vassika sāṭikāya naggāḥ kāyam ovassāpessanti iti
translated: “How can the monks from the group of six do this?”

original: Atha kho te bhikkhū chabbaggiye bhikkhū anekapariyāyena vigarahitvā bhagavato etamatthaṁ ārocesuṁ …pe…
analyzed: atha kho te bhikkhū chabbaggiye bhikkhū aneka pariyāyena vigarahitvā bhagavato etam attham ārocesuṃ pe
translated: The monks rebuked the monks from the group of six, “How can you do this?” …🔽“Is it true, monks, that you do this?”

original: “saccaṁ kira tumhe, bhikkhave, paṭikacceva vassikasāṭikacīvaraṁ pariyesatha?🔽Paṭikacceva katvā nivāsetha?🔽Jiṇṇāya vassikasāṭikāya naggā kāyaṁ ovassāpethā”ti?
analyzed: saccam kira tumhe bhikkhave paṭikacca iva vassika sāṭika cīvaram pariyesatha  paṭikaccā iva katvā nivāsetha  jiṇṇāya vassika sāṭikāya naggā kāyam ovassāpetha ati
translated: “Is it true, monks, that you do this?”

original: “Saccaṁ, bhagavā”ti.🔽Vigarahi buddho bhagavā …pe…
analyzed: sat ca bhagavān ati  vigarahi buddhaḥ bhagavān pe
translated: “It’s true, Sir.”

original: kathañhi nāma tumhe moghapurisā, paṭikacceva vassikasāṭikacīvaraṁ pariyesissatha, paṭikacceva katvā nivāsessatha, jiṇṇāya vassikasāṭikāya naggā kāyaṁ ovassāpessatha.
analyzed: katham hi nāma tumhe mogha purisā paṭikaccā iva vassika sāṭika cīvaram pariyesissatha paṭikaccā iva katvā nivāsessatha jiṇṇāya vassika sāṭikāya naggāḥ kāyam ovassāpessatha
translated: The Buddha rebuked them, “… Foolish men, how can you do this?

original: Netaṁ, moghapurisā, appasannānaṁ vā pasādāya …pe…
analyzed: neta moghapurisāḥ appasannānam vā pasādāya pe
translated: Foolish men, this neither inspires faith in the faithless …”

original: evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṁ sikkhāpadaṁ uddiseyyātha—
analyzed: evam ca pana bhikkhave imam sikkhāpadam uddiseyyātha
translated: And he told them to recite this training rule:🔽“If a monk searches for robe-cloth for the rainy season residence before the invitation ceremony, and then uses it before the old rainy-season robe has been cut and sewn, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.”

original: “‘Māso seso gimhānan’ti bhikkhunā vassikasāṭikacīvaraṁ pariyesitabbaṁ; ‘addhamāso seso gimhānan’ti katvā nivāsetabbaṁ.
analyzed: māsaḥ sesaḥ gimhānanti bhikkhunā vassika sāṭika cīvaram pariyesitabba addha māsaḥ sesaḥ gimhānanti katvā nivāsetabba
translated: ‘There is one month of the hot season remaining,’ a monk should look for a rainy season robe. ‘There is half a month of the hot season remaining,’ he should make use of it.

original: ‘Orena ce māso seso gimhānan’ti vassikasāṭikacīvaraṁ pariyeseyya, ‘orenaddhamāso seso gimhānan’ti katvā nivāseyya, nissaggiyaṁ pācittiyan”ti.
analyzed: orena ce māsaḥ sesaḥ gimhānanti vassika sāṭika cīvaram pariyeseyya orenaddha māsaḥ sesaḥ gimhānanti katvā nivāseyya nissaggiyam pācittiyan ti
translated: If he looks for a rainy season robe when there is more than a month of the hot season remaining, or if he makes use of it when there is more than half a month of the hot season remaining, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.’”

original: “Māso seso gimhānan”ti bhikkhunā vassikasāṭikacīvaraṁ pariyesitabbanti.
analyzed: māsaḥ sesaḥ gimhānanti bhikkhunā vassika sāṭika cīvaram pariyesitabbanti
translated: ‘There is one month of the hot season remaining, a monk should look for a rainy season robe’:

original: Ye manussā pubbepi vassikasāṭikacīvaraṁ denti te upasaṅkamitvā evamassu vacanīyā— “kālo vassikasāṭikāya, samayo vassikasāṭikāya, aññepi manussā vassikasāṭikacīvaraṁ dentī”ti.
analyzed: ye manussā pubbe pi vassika sāṭika cīvaram denti te upasaṅkamitvā evam assu vacanīyā kālaḥ vassika sāṭikāya samayaḥ vassika sāṭikāya aññe api manussā vassika sāṭika cīvaram denti iti
translated: he should approach those people who have previously given him a rainy season robe and say, “It’s the right time for the rainy season robe. It’s the right time for the rainy season robe. Other people are also giving rainy season robes.”

original: Na vattabbā— “detha me vassikasāṭikacīvaraṁ, āharatha me vassikasāṭikacīvaraṁ, parivattetha me vassikasāṭikacīvaraṁ, cetāpetha me vassikasāṭikacīvaran”ti.
analyzed: na vattabbā detha me vassika sāṭika cīvara āharatha me vassika sāṭika cīvara parivattetha me vassika sāṭika cīvara cetāpetha me vassika sāṭika cīvaranti
translated: He shouldn’t say, “Give me a rainy season robe. Bring me a rainy season robe. Exchange this rainy season robe for me. Buy a rainy season robe for me.”

original: “Addhamāso seso gimhānan”ti katvā nivāsetabbanti.
analyzed: addha māsaḥ sesaḥ gimhānanti katvā nivāsetabbanti
translated: ‘There is a half-month left of the hot season,’ then you should store it.

original: Addhamāse sese gimhāne katvā nivāsetabbaṁ.
analyzed: addha māse sese gimhāne katvā nivāsetabba
translated: You should store it when there is a half-month left of the hot season.

original: “Orena ce māso seso gimhānan”ti
analyzed: orena ce māsaḥ sesaḥ
translated: ‘There is a month left of the hot season,’

original: atirekamāse sese gimhāne vassikasāṭikacīvaraṁ pariyesati, nissaggiyaṁ pācittiyaṁ.
analyzed: atireka māse sese gimhāne vassika sāṭika cīvaram pariyesati nissaggiyam pācittiya
translated: if you look for a rainy-season robe when there is more than a month left of the hot season, you commit an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

original: “Orenaddhamāso seso gimhānan”ti
analyzed: orenaddha māsaḥ sesaḥ
translated: ‘There is a half-month left of the hot season,’

original: atirekaddhamāse sese gimhāne katvā nivāseti, nissaggiyaṁ hoti.
analyzed: atirekaddha māse sese gimhāne katvā nivāseti nissaggiyam hoti
translated: if you store it when there is less than a half-month left of the hot season, it becomes subject to relinquishment.

original: Nissajjitabbaṁ saṅghassa vā gaṇassa vā puggalassa vā.
analyzed: nissajjitabbam saṅghassa vā gaṇassa vā puggalassa vā
translated: It should be relinquished to a sangha, a group, or an individual.

original: Evañca pana, bhikkhave, nissajjitabbaṁ.🔽…pe…
analyzed: evam ca pana bhikkhave  pe
translated: And, monks, it should be relinquished like this.

original: “idaṁ me, bhante, vassikasāṭikacīvaraṁ atirekamāse sese gimhāne pariyiṭṭhaṁ atirekaddhamāse sese gimhāne katvā paridahitaṁ nissaggiyaṁ.
analyzed: idam me bhante vassika sāṭika cīvaram atireka māse sese gimhāne pariyiṭṭham atireka addha māse sese gimhāne katvā paridahitam nissaggiya
translated: ‘Venerables, this rainy-season robe, which I have looked for when there was more than a month left of the hot season and stored when there was less than a half-month left of the hot season, is to be relinquished.

original: Imāhaṁ saṅghassa nissajjāmī”ti …pe…🔽dadeyyāti …pe…
analyzed: imā aham saṅghassa nissajjāmi iti pe  dadeyyā ati pe
translated: I relinquish it to the Sangha.’ …🔽‘Give it to a sangha …’ …

original: dadeyyunti …pe…
analyzed: pe
translated: ‘Give it to a group …’ …

original: āyasmato dammīti.
analyzed: āyasmataḥ dammi iti
translated: ‘Give it to you.’”

original: Atirekamāse sese gimhāne atirekasaññī vassikasāṭikacīvaraṁ pariyesati, nissaggiyaṁ pācittiyaṁ.🔽Atirekamāse sese gimhāne vematiko vassikasāṭikacīvaraṁ pariyesati, nissaggiyaṁ pācittiyaṁ.
analyzed: atireka māse sese gimhāne atireka saññī vassika sāṭika cīvaram pariyesati nissaggiyam pācittiya  atireka māse sese gimhāne vematikaḥ vassika sāṭika cīvaram pariyesati nissaggiyam pācittiya
translated: If there is more than a month left of the hot season and he perceives it as more, and he searches for a rainy-season robe, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.🔽If there is more than a month left of the hot season, but he is unsure of it, and he searches for a rainy-season robe, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

original: Atirekamāse sese gimhāne ūnakasaññī vassikasāṭikacīvaraṁ pariyesati, nissaggiyaṁ pācittiyaṁ.🔽Atirekaddhamāse sese gimhāne atirekasaññī katvā nivāseti, nissaggiyaṁ pācittiyaṁ.🔽Atirekaddhamāse sese gimhāne vematiko katvā nivāseti, nissaggiyaṁ pācittiyaṁ.
analyzed: atireka māse sese gimhāne ūnaka saññī vassika sāṭika cīvaram pariyesati nissaggiyam pācittiya  atirekaddha māse sese gimhāne atireka saññī katvā nivāseti nissaggiyam pācittiya  atireka addha māse sese gimhāne vematiko katvā nivāseti nissaggiyam pācittiya
translated: If there is more than a month left of the hot season, but he perceives it as less, and he searches for a rainy-season robe, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.🔽If there is more than a half-month left of the hot season, but he perceives it as more, and he stores the rainy-season robe, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.🔽If there is more than a half-month left of the hot season, but he is unsure of it, and he stores the rainy-season robe, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

original: Atirekaddhamāse sese gimhāne ūnakasaññī katvā nivāseti, nissaggiyaṁ pācittiyaṁ.🔽Satiyā vassikasāṭikāya naggo kāyaṁ ovassāpeti, āpatti dukkaṭassa.🔽Ūnakamāse sese gimhāne atirekasaññī, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
analyzed: atireka addha māse sese gimhāne ūnaka saññī katvā nivāseti nissaggiyam pācittiya  satiyā vassika sāṭikāya naggo kāyam ovassāpeti āpatti dukkaṭassa  ūnaka māse sese gimhāne atireka saññī āpatti dukkaṭassa
translated: If there is more than a half-month left of the hot season, but he perceives it as less, and he stores the rainy-season robe, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.🔽If there is less than a month left of the hot season, but he perceives it as more, and he bathes naked in the rain, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.🔽If there is less than a month left of the hot season, but he is unsure of it, and he bathes naked in the rain, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: Ūnakamāse sese gimhāne vematiko, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
analyzed: ūnaka māse sese gimhāne vematikaḥ āpatti dukkaṭassa
translated: If there is less than a month left of the hot season, and he perceives it as less, and he bathes naked in the rain, there is no offense.

original: Ūnakamāse sese gimhāne ūnakasaññī, anāpatti.🔽Ūnakaddhamāse sese gimhāne atirekasaññī, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
analyzed: ūnaka māse sese gimhāne ūnaka saññī anāpatti  ūna kaddha māse sese gimhāne atireka saññī āpatti dukkaṭassa
translated: If there is less than a month left of the hot season, but he perceives it as more, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.🔽If there is less than a half-month left of the hot season, but he perceives it as more, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: Ūnakaddhamāse sese gimhāne vematiko, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
analyzed: ūna kaddha māse sese gimhāne vematiko āpatti dukkaṭassa
translated: If there is less than a half-month left of the hot season, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: Ūnakaddhamāse sese gimhāne ūnakasaññī, anāpatti.
analyzed: ūnaka ddha māse sese gimhāne ūnaka saññī anāpatti
translated: If there is less than a half-month left of the hot season, and he perceives it as less, there is no offense.

original: Anāpatti—🔽“māso seso gimhānan”ti vassikasāṭikacīvaraṁ pariyesati,🔽“addhamāso seso gimhānan”ti katvā nivāseti,
analyzed: anāpatti  māsaḥ sesaḥ vassika sāṭika cīvaram pariyesati  addha māsaḥ sesaḥ katvā nivāseti
translated: There is no offense if🔽he is looking for a rainy-season robe, thinking, “There is a month left of the hot season,”🔽and he stores it, thinking, “There is a half-month left of the hot season,”

original: “ūnakamāso seso gimhānan”ti vassikasāṭikacīvaraṁ pariyesati,
analyzed: ūnaka māsaḥ sesaḥ vassika sāṭika cīvaram pariyesati
translated: if he is looking for a rainy-season robe, thinking, “There is less than a month left of the hot season,”

original: “ūnakaddhamāso seso gimhānan”ti katvā nivāseti,🔽pariyiṭṭhāya vassikasāṭikāya vassaṁ ukkaḍḍhiyyati,
analyzed: ūna kaddha māsaḥ sesaḥ katvā nivāseti  pariyiṭṭhāya vassika sāṭikāya vassam ukkaḍḍhiyyati
translated: and he stores it, thinking, “There is less than a half-month left of the hot season,”🔽if he puts off the end of the rainy-season residence because the rainy-season robe has been found;

original: nivatthāya vassikasāṭikāya vassaṁ ukkaḍḍhiyyati, dhovitvā nikkhipitabbaṁ; samaye nivāsetabbaṁ,🔽acchinnacīvarassa,
analyzed: nivatthāya vassika sāṭikāya vassam ukkaḍḍhiyyati dhovitvā nikkhipitabba samaye nivāsetabba  a chinna cīvarassa
translated: if he puts off the end of the rainy-season residence because the rainy-season robe has been stored, but he then washes it and puts it aside, and he wears it when it is the right time;🔽if his robe has been stolen;

original: naṭṭhacīvarassa,
analyzed: naṭṭha cīvarassa
translated: if his robe has been lost;

original: āpadāsu,
analyzed: āpadāsu
translated: if there are dangers;

original: ummattakassa,
analyzed: ummattakassa
translated: if he is insane;

original: ādikammikassāti.🔽Vassikasāṭikasikkhāpadaṁ niṭṭhitaṁ catutthaṁ.
analyzed: ādikammikassa ati 🔽vassikasāṭika sikkhāpadam niṭṭhitam catuttha
translated: if he is the first offender.🔽The training rule on rainy-season robes, the fourth, is finished.
